description: The deck suggestions no longer have tags, but a new filter by author feature is available.
The Stories section has been divided in sub-sections per categories.
The site‚Äôs code is now available on GitHub (under GPL-3.0).
There now is a deck tracker to get accurate drawing chances during an actual game.
The deck builder now providers a (smart) random deck generator.
It is now possible to create tier lists of cards with the new tier list builder!
Discover the new feline card exclusively on Stormbound Kitty! üê±
Many thanks to MooreFunn for authoring a guide to play pirates!
The winner of the weekly card contest will receive a random epic card in game!
All 5 new feline cards have been added to the site.
The Card Contest page now displays the Hall of Fame of previous winning cards.
Stories are now first-class citizens and replace the quest builder in the top navigation.
All changes from the May update are now published: new cards, existing cards‚Äô update, new upgrade costs, new copies requirements.
The CSV file should now look decent when opened in a third-party software such as Excel.
Some existing cards now display community-authored stories in the card builder.
The filters for the collection view are now more suited for it (faction, status and level).
The 5 new cards from the upcoming update are now available.
The complete Stormbound guide by Arikrat is now available on the site!
Decks can now be exported as images to be shared more easily.
It is now possible to import and export cards collections.
Cards can now be selected with keys 1 to 4, played with ‚ÄúP‚Äù, cycled with ‚ÄúC‚Äù and the turn can be ended with ‚ÄúE‚Äù.
The card builder now has a display mode to hide the editing interface.
The desktop version of the simulator will now load a random background.
The site‚Äôs footer has been redesigned to provide more information and offer a way to make a small donation.
It is now possible to dry-run equal decks by clicking ‚ÄúReset game‚Äù and checking ‚ÄúReset in equal levels‚Äù.
Updating the level of a card in the deck can be done by re-adding the card with a different level.
The footer now includes a link to the outstanding Stormbound Guide from Arikrat.
Collector Mirz now spawns tokens of all races, and their chances of draw work as intended.
It is now possible to filter decks based on whether they include a certain card.
Clicking/tapping on a card in the deck detail view will now enlarge the card.
Cards can now be defined across 5 levels. All formerly created cards will still work.
Dawnsparks now have a RNG setting to define whether they will live and hit or die.
It is now possible to display the draw chances of all cards in the dry-runner.
Beasts of Terror is now considered to be an AoE (Area Of Effect) card.
The deck suggestions are now paginated to avoid a costly initial paint of the entire list.
The cards‚Äô level can be quickly switched with keyboard keys 1 to 5.
The suggested decks are now divided in 3 different categories: regular, Diamond 1 and tournament.
The site is officially renamed as ‚ÄúStormbound Kitty‚Äù and has its own domain.
The weekly card contest now has a proper dedicated page to promote it.
The layout of the desktop version has been entirely refined to better showcase the game background.
In the (hopefully) rare cases where the application would crash, there is now an error page that explains what happened and what to do from there.
The card is automatically saved in the URL at every update, just like for the battle sim or the deck builder.
The quest is automatically saved in the URL at every update, just like for the battle sim or the deck builder.
The players‚Äô faction are now inferred by the units placed on the board.
When supported by the phone, sharing will go through the OS sharing hub instead of the clipboard.
The card ability now supports bold text with Markdown-style syntax (*bold*).
There is now a lot of Diamond 1 decks to choose from.
Clicking/tapping a card from a deck suggestion will enlarge that card like in the game.
Finally have a proper home page, which doesn‚Äôt look like a Sharpfist Exile‚Äôs turd.
Cards in decks are now tinted according to their type (unit, spell or structure), as well as their rarity for legendary cards‚Äîjust like in the game.
The bug where Collector Mirz‚Äô token cards would never be drawn in dry-run due to them sharing a unique ID is now fixed.
The header and navigation on mobile should be a bit more convenient now and will no longer take half the screen on all pages.
There is now an entire section dedicated to ready-to-use decks, with filtering for specific criteria (diamond 1, beginner-friendly, etc.).
Switching between the editor and the display mode of the battle simulator is now easier than ever from the sub menu.
All pop-ups aimed at confirming a reset of the current state (across tools) now use the Execution image to reinforce the idea that reset is permanent.
In case of puzzles, the battle simulator will display the puzzle details on the right side (right panel on mobile) so it‚Äôs easier to play.
